summary:
Master XSS attack vectors and defense mechanisms. Study reflected, stored, and DOM-based XSS.  Learn content security policies, input sanitization, and output encoding to prevent XSS attacks. The lesson includes detailed explanations, visual aids, and assessment tools to ensure mastery of the concepts.

This topic provides essential knowledge for understanding cybersecurity at the Secondary level. Through comprehensive study, students will develop a deep understanding of the concepts, principles, and applications related to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in real-world contexts. This topic provides comprehensive coverage essential for understanding cybersecurity at the intermediate level. Through detailed study, students will gain deep insights into the concepts, principles, and real-world applications. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in various contexts.
why_it_matters: This programming/technology topic provides practical skills highly sought after in the job market and enables you to build real-world applications and solve technical problems.

assignments.title: Research Assignment: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
assignments.description: Complete a research assignment exploring key concepts related to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
tasks: Read the assigned textbook chapters and online resources about Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
Identify and explain at least three key concepts from the topic
Find one real-world example or application of these concepts
Write a 300-500 word summary explaining your findings
Include at least two credible sources in your research

assignments.title: Practical Exercise: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
assignments.description: Apply your understanding of Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) through hands-on activities.
tasks: Complete the lab exercises or simulations related to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
Document your observations and findings in a lab report
Answer the reflection questions about what you learned
Create a visual representation (diagram, chart, or model) of key concepts
Present your findings to the class or submit a written report
